values:
This summer has gone by so quickly that I still don't realize it's almost over. There's a month left and it feels like it just started, you know? I've been working between 35-40 hour weeks at the job and, I'm not going to lie, it doesn't make me feel mature, only tired. Atleast now my house is retiled and I'm not watching that smelly house (and the dogs) and thus I can sleep in past 7 am regularly. The moneys added up quickly and all things considered it was relatively painless.

Sunday I worked a 5 hour shift before the mall even opened, then i hung out with josh, went to dinner with crespo at chili's (Where, I discovered today, 4 days later, I left my wallet... I got my wallet and ID back but lost $50) and then played pictionary at megan's. Then I was suddenly overwhelmingly tired and promptly went home where I discovered my throat was sore and I had a hundred point something fever.

That said, except to go to the doctors office and on a few 5 minute excursions I havent left my house since then. I'm on medicine but I'm still feeling mighty crappy, and I don't know why, but my throat and I can never seem to get along.

But the negative aside, I'm exceedingly happy with everything right now. It's kind of a bummer that I havent seen anyone in awhile, but I don't think I'd have been much fun out and about anyway.

Tomorrow I'm flying to NYC to stay with my brother for the weekend. I hope I start to feel better. Soon. Now. Please?

This week:

I saw a movie in theatres for the first time in a long time. For free.
I worked a lot. Hard, too.
I broke in a pair of really cute shoes.
I bought a pair of tennis shoes.
I've been in contact with a few too many dogs.
I made myself jewelery.
I've been woken up at 7am for the crazy tile people every morning.
I went to the library.
I played a lot of guitar.
I have not eaten a home made meal once. Except a sandwich at Sean's house, if that counts.
I went to the high school.
I drove home a girl whom I did not know.
I had awkward conversations with my parents.
I went to the doctor.
I got stuff for college.

I've left out much more than I've told. Mostly so that whenever I talk about anything that's happened, you'll still want to listen.

It's been a while.  But I'm okay with that, because we've been together for all the important stuff anyway:

We finsihed high school. We got sun burnt promptly thereafter. We graduation-rehearsed, then we (I, more accurately) nearly puked up 20 ounces of beef, but didn't. We all walked across stage without tripping. We played poker with chips in denominations of millions of pesos. Briefly, we were aliens and did some weeeeeeird stuff. We miraculously found my flip flops.

It's been decided that I'm going to Tufts. I'm excited; suddenly I'm getting college mail again, but this time it's all from the same school, the one I'm going to. It feels nice. Finally.

Josh is home.

Lately, everything is so much easier, better, whole, good. Happy. Really happy.

We schooled Mucino's class today in kickball. Best stats class ever. 

3 AP's down. 2 to go.
4 more days.

I haven't updated in awhile, which is justifiable, but also kind of sad because I'm almost positive I had a lot of important things to say.

Prom was amazing in its entirety. I literally loved every second and every song-- my humps, the electric slide, whatsitcalled from grease-- and every smile and every sip and every spill-- the salsa and the gatorade-- and every trip to the bathroom-- both other people's and my own. Granted I only have 10 pictures, but compiled with Lisa's and the others I'm expecting from all of you sometime soon, I'm pretty sure I will never forget how much fun it was.

Seriously, everything was perfect, or near enough, anyway. A blackeyed peas cd was in the limo's cd player by some miracle; dinner was delicious and relatively mess-free; and we made it to prom just in time to be admitted as VIP's via the coop, and hear the infamous My Humps followed by that annoying yet catchy booty (x's 5) song. Yeah, you know the one.

The hotel was equally enjoyable, and the other whs-er's there were fun, too. It was right on the beach, and after the rain stopped some of us went for a late night stroll to get a break from the 5 or 6 kids who were hiding in our room from a threatening security gaurd patrolling the hall near their rooms. After laughing at medoff, jordan, and 2 drunk boys, for their sad attempts at drunken pickups, i stayed up all night with zac and sean to see the sunrise.

The next day at the beach Garcia, Philip, and I swam down to Ocean Reef Park and Medoff lagged behind. We climbed on the rocks, but we didnt see any fish. After walking back and failing at finding crabs, we hung out at the pool. Eventually Adam, Medoff, Philip, Carlee, Garcia and I headed to lunch at Cheeburger, and then on home.

This week has been filled with sleep deprivation and Poetry Live and fun. PL went relatively well. Granted only what 8? of us do anything at all, but I'm kind of glad because I really like those 7 other people. Performing was really fun and so dancing on stage once it was all over and done with. I'm so glad it's finally over... yet, it's bitter sweet because everything is really finally over. High school ends in 9 days. 

Now comes studying for AP exams and the actual AP exams and that pathfinder thing and the last day of school and finishing my gold award paper work and more scholarship applications and more time at work and then graduation. Then what?

Sigh.

I'm not worried that I won't have fun; I know I will.

I'm worried that I'll spend the whole night wishing he was there.

It's a weird feeling.

This trip may only have served to confirm what, in retrospect, I guess I already knew, but nonetheless it was much needed because I didn't know I already knew anything, and part of me still doesn't. Still following? [Good.]

Friday my mom, my brother and I went to Tufts in the morning before going to meet Doug for lunch at Harvard and then going to BC. [Choices, choices. Eek.]

Then Josh met us somewhere just outside of downtown Boston and we all went to see the Bunker Hill monument at the request of my brother. [yes, it was as dull as it sounds.] We ate dinner downtown, bought an umbrella, and at another request of my brother we wandered around looking for the Boston Massacre sight which apparently has been misplaced [??].

Then Josh took me with him to see the Yeah Yeah Yeahs and I had a really [really] good night to top off a really [really] good day.

Saturday, at my mom's suggestion [not that I complained whatsoever], her and I went back with Josh to Brown, so I could see the school again incase I eventually end up getting in [wishful thinking]. We wandered around a little, then while my mom chilled in a library Josh showed me his room [heh.] and introduced me to some people and before I was ready to leave it was time to go back to Boston [:(]. Last night my mom and I had a rather late dinner with a family friend who now lives in Boston, even though this morning we had to wake up at 6am to catch our flight. I have successfully stayed busy all day, yet have completed very little of what I wanted to get done. [Funny how that happens, huh?]

All the cool kids are getting away this weekend.

I'm going to Boston.

I'm excited like whoa.

This week has been quite the contradiction. I'm glad that the whole college waiting process is done and over and yet I can't deny that I'm disappointed. I'm not a pessimist-- I know I'll be happy where ever I end up, but I have no problem admitting I'm jealous of everyone else who not only knows exactly what they want, but got it; so easily, too. I worked just as hard, harder than some; I'm not saying people don't deserve what they got, I just wish I got the same sort of recognition. I'm so petty and immature. I'm sure this is supposed to teach me something, but it's hard to grow when you feel like you're lacking something that everyone else has.

I'm getting what's good for me. I know that much. But the largest part of me is still a kid and I'd rather have what I wanted most then settle for what I got.

If I had the chance to redo it, I wouldnt have done anything differently. I couldnt have tried any harder. I am what I am. It's weird that that thought is both so heartbreaking and comforting at the same time.

As stressful and sad as some parts were, this week was also lazy and relaxing and I'm so happy that Josh was home.

In the days after you leave I always feel a little bit lost, like you packed a part of me in your suitcase, like my heart is 1,000  miles away from here. I'm glad that you have that part of me with you, but I wish I had a piece of you here with me, too.

I need a lot of little things. I need comfort. I need to smile more. I need a hug. I need a kiss. I need to sleep. I need to sleep in your arms. I need to not read old letters written by people I miss terribly. I need new letters from people I miss terribly. I need help. I need someone who will understand. I need someone who's willing to listen. I need to give up. I need to try harder. I need to scream. I need to stop letting you try to turn me into somebody else. I need to stop wanting you to be somebody else. I need to stop compromising. I need to stop waiting. I need time. I need a long walk. I need to be less afraid. I need to be more independent. I need to be alone. I need you to miss me. I need you. I need to stop worrying. I need to feel wanted. I need to feel beautiful. I need attention. I need a phone call. I need to hear your voice. I need to hear you say you love me, and I need to know you do. I need you to need me, how I need you.

I need to lower my expectations.

Busch Gardens was awesome.

Unlike philip though, I can't say I wouldnt change anything. If i could, I would definitely erase the kid in the green shirt. (I still dont know his name. God he was an annoying $#@*&. )

"i lovue katie lijewicz like whoa."

Miss Dolph never fails to brighten my day.

:o)

The people that I love are amazing in ways that they will never know; lifes been really good lately. Despite its goodness, I still find myself needing to vent because things have also been really disappointing lately. Disappointing because no one seems to want to let anything reach its potential. Part of me would rather have a constant neutral than these constant, intense ups and downs, but the bigger part of me knows that's stupid because I'd be missing out on a lot.

It's just that lately I feel like i've become as passive as I never want to be; I've resigned to just allowing myself to be pulled along for the ride, not reacting to anything because I know I'm passionate and if i react I'll just make things worse. It's easier to sit by and watch things slowly deteriorate than to do anything that will make it happen any quicker. Cant make it better, then dont make it worse. Just take it for what it is.  nothing I do makes any difference and everything you don't do has been tearing me apart.  I don't know  why I never say the words i want to when I should. I dont know why i have to be the one to say something. why cant you say something? 

Back to the happy stuff, eh? yeah. happy stuff like cookies n cream ice cream, the beach, 4 day weekends, spring break, saturday nights, steak n shake, ipods, clear skies, crayons, catch phrase, taboo, tshirts,  and birthdays. ahem. unbirthdays.

Speaking of which, happy unbirthday to all,
and to all, a goodnight.

The best entries are the ones that no one comments on, the ones where I know I said something because no one knows how to respond to it. The ones that no one even wants to say anything about in conversation because they don't know what to say besides what's already been said.
The best phone calls are the ones when someone calls and talks animatedly to me about nothing of any importance even though theyre tired, because I'm the only person they could think of to call, because they knew I'd listen. Because they knew I'd be the best person to say goodnight to.
The best nights are the private ones, the secret ones, the ones that I dont even care enough to ask what anyone else is doing because doing what I want to do is more important than who I do it with. And because the people I really want around are already apart of it without me having to ask.

we watched the sunrise before we said our goodbyes and if not in the months before, then in those moments, i fell in love. you painted feelings and words and memories in the sand on my skin with your hands, with your heat, with your heart; now you're gone, and the graffiti that makes me feel like a masterpiece is still here, but being slowly painted over by time, by each passing sunrise, sunset that you're not here to feel.
   somtimes when i look at you in pictures i feel your black hole irises tugging at my soul and ripping off my flesh before patching me back up with seams exposed and mocking a completness i once i had but that was lost as easily as teenage innocence in a dark room, empty house. i love you from the bottom of my shoes; shoes that, when you were here, were firmly planted, weighted down to the surface by a burning friction at my feet, but are now so eager to find you, follow after you, through an endless expanse of time.
    i cant pretend like i dont feel every exponentially distant mile between us when your kisses are fading from my skin, when your smile is fading from my memory. because i do.

Unlike every other three day weekend I've ever had, I actually feel like I got everything out of this one that I wanted.

To anyone who was somehow apart of this weekend, I almost want to say I love you, but instead I'll stick with this: to different people in semi-chronological order, thank you for...
betting on how long it would take to fight at our prom meeting.
fighting at our prom meeting.
getting the waiter mad at you by spilling water on him.
making that comment about 2 people being in the shower.
driving me home.
saying you love me.
not yelling at me for sucking at horseshoes.
atomic bombs.
picking women's soccer for "hilarious."
not knowing the word plaid.
enjoying my president's day card.

I'm in such a good mood that I don't want to go to sleep because I have a feeling that 6:30 am might just take it away.

Besides the spanish music/people/lack of front door and parking, the prom planning turned out to be rather anti-climatic; although, it was rather fun to see philip and jordan have their little spat. We didn't actually plan, so much as get what was to be planned out in the open. Atleast we agree on the fact that we're going to prom. I think.

I feel like the drama is subsiding and for the most part were back to normal. Except for the fact that Medoff went on a "date" last night; that's not normal. He's only what? 12? he's not supposed to like girls yet.

Last night everyone went home early because they were tired and even though I had a 3 hour nap yesterday I was tired too. I think it was something about this past week.  Or maybe I'm sick again. Still? eh.

Happy almost President's Day. Happy almost my-birthday.

I really hated seeing everyone wearing red and pink and holding flowers and bears because it's sad to think about how they expected gifts, how they wanted them more than they liked them. I like it better when there are no expectations and no room for disapointment, but it seems like these days everyone expects something.

Other than that, I really love the holiday cause I think everybody needs a little lovin'. Plus, everybody loves flowers, chocolate and/or pot lids. I mean, I know I do.

Anyway, happy valentine's day.

This week has been.   No adjective needed, it just was.

I'm feeling a little bit better, but also a little bit worse. I think these past 2 weeks I've spent more time sleeping then I have spent awake. And I'm okay with that.

Things I've learned this week:

zen (I think the actual word used was "ku" ??) moments are quite nice.

Things are much easier when you're honest.

Really awkward situations are only embarassing if you let them be.

I find the idea of us tap dancing much more humorous than I should.

My upside-down balance is better than Adam's.

Philip is cartwheel retarded.

 Cold water and competition are probably a bad mix. (especially if your hands are always colder than everyone else's)

It felt okay being lost in a sea of green. Actually, it felt more than okay; it felt happy. Really, really happy.

(And, yes, the glasses confirmed it. It's 2006. We're graduating.)

Man, what's with me and updating lately?

My thoughts are a train wreck and you're on the tracks:

-I feel like I have so much more time than I used to, only nothing more gets done because I find such entertaining ways of distracting myself, and suddendly I don't know where the day went.
-It's eight o'clock? How did that happen?
- Naps are nice, but not when they're totally unintentional.
-Financial aid and scholarships are a pain in the ass.
- Fun is good. But fun is more fun when you share it with fun people.
-There are some people I don't like, but I always seem to forget how much I dislike them.
-I don't know who it is that's making things so complicated, me or you. Yes, I mean you.
-I think a large majority of what you say and do is bullshit. But I mean that in the nicest way because I don't think you know what you're doing. (And because a lot of what I say and do is bullshit, too.)
- I wish I could stop thinking about then and start thinking about now. Face my feelings.
- I wish I could say exactly what I want to.
- I wish you would say exactly what I you want to, or atleast what I want you to.
- I really, really, wish there wasn't anything I wanted you to say.
- Sam, I'm sorry for fighting with you this morning. I think it was a combination of sleep deprivation, fever, stress, and all around grumpiness. Cause I really don't care that much about colors. Infact, I'm totally backwards in the way that:
- The times I really should be expressing my frustrations are the times I'm quiet.
- I talk about other people too much.
- I don't talk about myself as much as I need to. And that doesn't make me self centered.
- I need one straight dose of honesty. Then everything would be better.
-It's funny that I say "everything" in reference to one thing, because everything else is actually really good right now.
- I ignore the bad side of things even though I know it'll blow up later because it's so easy to do. 
- I'm actually pretty much up to date with litmag and art pieces which is amazing. AMAZING.
- It's also amazing that there are only 3 college interviews and 2 months until admissions decisions.
- 29 days (or 28 depending on when you'd say it is) until my birthday (and the lotto, strippers, clubs, and porn). 
- On my own, ending on a good note is my forte.

I feel like winter break just ended, even though I've been back in school for ages. Josh does that to me.

I feel like time is playing tricks on me again and I kind of like it. I kind of hate it, too. Time has blurred everything together; I feel like I'm in the back row of Mr. Mucino's room while he's writing on the overhead and I'm not wearing my glasses. I'm squinting,  and where are my glasses? In my bag.

But now I'm in Mr. Perdomo's room and he owes me $10 and he has big gross sweat stains under his arms, but he looks out for me the same way Mr. Mucino did and it's kind of endearing.

Someone was talking about Mrs. Henderson today and I remember her saying she would come to graduation and hold a sign and cheer for us. That seems like yesterday, doesn't it? And now we're really graduating and that's... that's weird.

I miss being driven to school every morning by my parents, then Amanda's parents, then my brother, and I miss parking spot 240. I really do. I know next year I'll miss parking spot 14, too.

I remember what it felt like when I didn't know where I wanted to apply to college. I remember what it felt liken when I didn't get in to where I wanted to go. And now I know what it feels like to wait and to try to convince myself that I still don't know where I want to go. 

I'm not actively waiting, not yet, but I know eventually I'll realize that I should be, and I will.

It's scary that everyone knows something about their futures, something I don't know about mine. It's scary that I feel like I'm being left behind when nothing has even started yet.

I feel like college is just a dream. I know it must be real because I know you've gotten in, and I know you're there, and Josh, I know you just left to go back to college, too. It must be real because it's changed you all so much, it's changed how I see you, how you see yourself, how you see me. But it doesn't seem real. It feels so make believe.

I've been so happy lately, and even crying was okay because I'm in love. I've said a thousand goodbye's, but knowing so markedly how much I'll miss you makes me teary eyed and I can't help it. I don't really want to, either. 

I'm rambling, I've been rambling, but rambling is good for the soul. This has been a good year. This is going to be a good week. I hope.

Best part of the day...

I got a note in statistics that read:

"Dear Katie,

Whatchyou gonna do with all that junk?

--Curt"


That song is way to catchy.

Two years ago tonight Lisa, Adam, Sam and I played strip poker in my living room and drank sparkling apple cider while enjoying eachothers company.

Then we met those crazy seniors (now freshmen?) thus, last year tonight we were all at an oversized new year's party laughing at Dan for sticking bottle rockets places they don't belong.

So much has changed, and yet everything is still so much the same.


Any predictions on what's in store for us in 2006?
(besides me finishing college applications)

I feel left out of the exciting journal update with bold letters and 40 point font.

Instead I get this:

 I didn't get in.

 

But I have been getting a bucket load of unrestrained pity, and I'm not quite sure how I feel about that. I'd probably be upset without it, but I don't really know how to respond to it, either.

It amazes me that something so simple as the phone call I got from Rachel last night is by far the single most thoughtful thing anyone has done for me lately. I don't even think it took much thought, but thank you Rachel, none the less. (And I promise I'll try to make sure that our talent doesn't really come unplugged.)

I woke up lateish today after having a strange series of dreams that were vivid and fun, and when I woke up I was disspointed that they didn't really happen, that I was just in bed, at home, alone, with no one to even describe them to. So it goes, I guess; things change and life isn't quite what it used to be. Maybe it's about time I stop dreaming anyway; it doesn't get me anywhere.

Last night was random, and informative, too. fyi- diamond-shaped yellow signs picturing red octagons and an arrow pointing to the sky indicate a stop sign ahead, not stop signs falling from the sky. ...Abolition?  :o) You guys are fun.

Friday night I saw Harry Potter with my mom and it was good jolly fun. Friday night I realized that if we ever did have magic, we've probably lost it by now; I think it's strange that we're able to lose things even when we want them so badly.

I feel like I'm always wishing and waiting, not for something but for things to be better, different, or I guess the same?, but nothing ever happens. Do you have any idea how that feels?

There's so much to say, but I say so little. This is the best I can do.

Monday:
Mr. Sink: "Yeah, I didn't really mean to give you 10 essays. I don't know what I was thinking."

Mike: "My little squirrel."

Sam: "Do you think that's enough tape to get the mirror back on?"

Tuesday:
Mr. Perdomo: "No more talking. Mike, get away from Katie. Katie, walk near me. Don't talk."
Adam: "I'm pretty sure Paticia and that other girl have out papers and are writing down answers.
Perdomo: "Adam, shh, I said no talking."

Lucas: "You don't know what you're talking about. Mr. Perdomo does; he's the teacher."
Me: *LAUGH*
Adam: "Lucas, pseudo intellectualism wasn't part of the assignment."

Wednesday:
*scratches head* I think I've managed to actually repress most of Wednesday.

Thursday:
Adam: "Can you tell there's a giant hole in the back of my pants? No, seriously, look."

Mike: "But, Katie didnt do her homework at home either!"

Mr. Perdomo: "Why are you so angry Katie, your face is all red."
Lucas: "yeah, because you don't know what you're talking about."
Adam: "Pseudo intellectualism is NOT part of the assignment."

Mr.Perdomo: "Katie, you know you can talk to me, right?"

Adam: "Yeah, so I told them about the hole in my pants."
Mrs. Hathaway: "Oh my!"

Friday:
Mr.Sink: "Question 7-- How many amendments are in the constitution?"
and Question 8-- write the number of the amendment that's your favorite."
Class: "just the number? Not, like, what it is?"
Mr.Sink: "Just a number. But make sure it's not higher than 27, because there are only 27 amendments."

Mrs.Cooperman: "I wonder if she just loves all the milkmen. I mean, she might have a thing going on with the electricians and plumbers, too."

John Y: "Mr. Zucker, your eyebrows are, like, deformed."

Laura(? I think?): "Some people say when the pope dies, he doesn't rot, because he's going to become a saint. I don't know if that's true because I don't think that maggots know he's the pope, and even if they do know, I doubt they're Catholic."

I want a time machine, but I don't even really need one; I'd hate to state the obvious but if things got better now, I'd be okay here.

So, things, get better.
Or, (anyone who has knowledge of time travel and some free time), build that time machine.

Please?

...and everything always comes around back to you, that easily. I forgot to put that song on your cd, even though I know I meant to; how did I forget? Maybe I'd feel better if I had. All day I've been getting these 3.5 second dizzy spells, like everything in my head is going too fast, or maybe it's everything around me that's going too fast, but how can that be when everything's going so by so, so slowly? Seriously, this time management thing has gotten easier, and it's not because I have any less to do; it's like time is trying to help, and driving me crazy is just a side effect.
  
It's funny that this whole college-separation thing is finally wearing me down when you're all about to come home. I hate not being able to understand, and I hate the awkwardness when I don't know how to respond, and I hate feeling like home (or whatever you call this place now) isn't the same anymore, like it's inferior to how it was before ( and it is because I can tell atleast part of you has moved on). Part of me has grown to hate letters, because even though sometimes they make you feel closer, they also make you feel so far away. When you're within 20 miles theres no need to write; why do you have to be so far?

*dizziness*

*sigh*
On a shallower note, why does everyone always make the biggest production when I wear the slightest bit of makeup? I get strange looks for not caring, but I feel like people look and me even more strangely when I do. What's up with that?

I've been watching too much tv. But the real point of this entry is to tell you I learned that according to Feng Shui, the love center of my house is my bedroom.

Just thought you'd like to know.

We haven't been to school in ages, and we're not going back till atleast Thursday. Sam, Garcia, Adam, Medoff, Philip, my mom, my dad, and myself made an escape from hurricane hell to Orlando for the night on Saturday. It was so much more fun than being at home in the dark, or even sleeping over somewhere with power. The car ride up seems so much shorter with good company and good music, and Halloween Horror nights itself was amazingly fun.  Who doesn't laugh when someone wags a chainsaw in their face, or shrieks pop tart? I certainly do. And I think we were all comforted by the fact that my dad is the biggest pansy of us all. 

Afterwards we left the park and time travelled back to the hotel room (which had a door bell?) and talked awhile before going to bed. We had lunch and went home and I HAD POWER. I had a deliciously warm shower last night, even though I had one yesterday morning, and then I played on the computer because, oh my sweet lord, have i missed the computer.

This week the days seemed so long, but now I think about it and it's already Halloween and it's already November. This week is already over; this year is almost over. Time is slipping through my fingers and I don't know if I should clench my fist and try to hold on or just let it all go, but either way its dripping, dripping, gone. And you're almost home, and I'm happy, but that just means you're almost gone again, you know? When will your home be where my home is again?

It seems like we've been hearing about this hurricane for a year, and I'm tired of it. Mostly because it scared hanson away, and I like hanson, so that made me sad. Really, really sad. Really.

In other news, M Butterfly was a mighty entertaining read, my college application is complete (like whoa), and on its way to getting in the mail before it rains (or doesn't rain, depeding on what this hurricane is going to do), and my sociology midterm is monday (huh. maybe i should get to studying?).

This weeks been... weird. Yeah.


How many days till thanksgiving?

"Twilight"

I was stained, with a role, in a day not my own 
But as you walked into my life you showed what needed to be shown 
And I always knew, what was right I just didn't know that I might 
Peel away and choose to see with such a different sight 

And I will never see the sky the same way and 
I will learn to say good-bye to yesterday and 
I will never cease to fly if held down and 
I will always reach too high cause I've seen, cause I've seen, twilight 

Never cared never wanted 
Never sought to see what flaunted 
So on purpose so in my face
Couldn't see beyond my own place 
And it was so easy not to behold what I could hold 
But you taught me I could change
Whatever came within these shallow days 

And I will never see the sky the same way and 
I will learn to say good-bye to yesterday and 
I will never cease to fly if held down and 
I will always reach too high cause I've seen, cause I've seen

As the sun shines through it pushes away and pushes ahead 
It fills the warmth of blue and leaves a chill instead and 
I didn't know that I could be so blind to all that is so real 
But as illusion dies I see there is so much to be revealed 

And I will never see the sky the same way and 
I will learn to say good-bye to yesterday and 
I will never cease to fly if held down and 
I will always reach too high cause I've seen, cause I've seen, twilight 

I was stained, by a role, in a day not my own 
But as you walked into my life you showed what needed to be shown 
And I always knew, what was right
I just didn't know that I might 
Peel away and choose to see with such a different sight 

And I will never see the sky the same way and 
I will learn to say good-bye to yesterday and 
I will never cease to fly if held down and 
I will always reach too high cause I've seen, cause I've seen, twilight...

Part of "Get Up and Go"

What could I give when you've got all you need

Freak lightning strikes that knock out the school's power and cancel school for the day should happen more often, even if they're planned by the faculty and not by god, because they allow for a lot of spontaneity and fun.

Today was what I always imagined senior year was supposed to be like. And it was nice (minus the slight-courtyard-chaos).

We got out at 8 something (after I had a brief awkwardness with Josh's roommate on the phone), proceeded to "discuss" what to do with the day until 9 something while waiting for traffic to clear, and eventually went onward to city place. We brookstoned it for a good thirty minutes, and ate at City Pizza, which has been expanded (*gasp* i know) to double its size and is just as good as ever.

Then we went onto the beach, where the changing was easy and weather was perfect. I love that spot on the beach with the shallower water that I can stand in until a good 15 feet out. I also love friends who make me forget, even if momentarily, that there is a bigger world out there than just us.

Sometimes it's okay to stop worrying and to just have fun; even when you're supposed to be in school; even when you're missing someone terribly.

I love you guys.

And Josh, assuming you still read this, I love you too.

So... Last night Kathy hugged a freaked-out spanish stranger, Josh almost died from Dr Pepper, I hit on a burger king employee, Medoff needed some preperation H, and Sam was momentarily a lesbian.

Last night Josh was going to streak but couldn't. And last night we all climbed a tree and then Sam got shot. Got a shot, sorry. At the hospital. It was a good time, or atleast it will be a good memory, and it was a good distraction from the fact that Josh was leaving.



...And he went. And he's probably in Boston right now, as I'm typing this, and that's kind of a cool thought. Except for the fact that he's not here.

It'll take some getting used to the fact that he's gone, and that everyone else is gone, too(except for us cool junior/seniors). But I'll get used to it, we all will, and before we know it they'll all be back, and soon we'll be leaving too. Wow. That's fucked up, isn't it?


We'll all be leaving soon too.

I haven't updated in along, long while. I was looking back at my old entries though, and now I kind of wish I'd been updating this whole time, so I'd have something to help me remember this summer. But maybe what I can't remember on my own, isn't worth remembering, anyway.

So, long story short, this summers been good (as I'm sure you've read in everyone else's lj anyway; my updating really would have been superfluous), despite the fact that we seem to have collectively given up on the movie (and the boat) that we were so passionate about at some point.

I just got back from a Boston/New England college-tour-trip yesterday morning. It was... informative. Well, not really. Well, kind of. You can see I'm conflicted; I don't know what the eff to do. I could use some help, but I don't know who to ask; and I dont really want any help, either. I already know what I want to do, I just want someone to tell me that I can, and that it's okay and that... I'll be happy next year around this time.

I want people to make me all the right promises and to mean them, and I want some things to never change. I want a lot of things that I know I can't have, things I can't even bring myself to ask for. 

But there's that little part of me that still wants to ask. Y'know?

...Yeah.

Since I'm slow and everyone beats me to updating about all the craziness that goes on, here's a brief overview:
Thursday: Flowers and Fun with Josh.
Friday: Mall and Madagascar and Megan calling Adam and More that I can't remember.
Saturday: Cleaning and Clothes and CPK, Chilling, a Crossword puzzle, a Car that belonged to Doug and a Curfew.
Sunday(this is where the aliteration ends):
Shopping with mom and then Family visiting and Lit-Mag party and more Family and Monica's for crazy sweaty dancing and the Dance-off and Dan driving me home.

*sigh*

end.

And so she watched. And the magical Mr.Mucino made the card he was holding disappear, but she never saw it anyway because she wasn't wearing her glasses. If my dad knew he'd say "That's why you should alawys wear your glasses." Of course, so you can see things that are going to disappear anyway.

-----------------------------------------------------

I just don't think I'll ever feel comfortable parking in the first row. It's a nice short walk to class, but these days I feel like I could use a longer one with time to think and time to breathe and time to realize what's going on. Maybe short is better; no time to realize how different everything really is. It's 6 rows closer and it's a different perspective, a scary one, one I'm not ready for. After school, the parking lot is only a quarter full (...three-quarters empty?), and the kids all look so young. We're all so young. I don't want there to be next year, and I really don't want to feel like I'm missing something when I turn and see 240 empty and the shade looking so nice.

But I kind of do because it already seems as far away as everything else, and it's not even tomorrow yet.

-----------------------------------------------------

...my nose hurts.

And now for a guest appearance (in a poem/not really a poem at all/ my mindless ramblings) by one of my all-time favorite words/phrases: question mark.

"?"
I know that question mark isn't there by mistake
It was strategically placed
To make me wonder,
And make me hope
That someday you'd be telling me,
Instead of asking me;
That you'd be certain and 
You'd be happy,
Instead of holding out for something better.
Somehow you can pretend that that question mark's invisible
Like I can't hear the change in pitch of your voice,
And you can't see the dissapointment in my eyes.
That question mark carries so much meaning
That the phrase it follows is tipping to the right under its weight;
It's leaning towards confusion,
Towards uncertainty,
Towards everything it shouldn't be,
Everything it's not supposed to mean.
I don't know how to respond
When you tell me,
When you ask me...
When you say, "I love you?"
And it's funny because you never had to say you did;
I was content as long as you didn't say you didnt.
But that question mark,
It isn't there by mistake
It was strategically placed
To make me realize
You don't love me;
Not the way that I love you.
